mocafe.math.sigmoid(variable, c: float, a: float, b: float, slope: float)

Simple sigmoid function defined as:

\[y(x) = \frac{a \cdot e^{slope \cdot c} + b \cdot e^{r \cdot x}}{e^{slope \cdot c} + e^{slope \cdot c}}\]

Where: \(a\) represent the value of the sigmoid for x -> -Inf; \(b\) represent the value of the sigmoid for x -> +Inf; \(c\) represent the center of the sigmoid (where the derivative is max); .math:slope represent the slope of the sigmoid.

Parameters

  • variable – variable x for which the sigmoid is defined

  • c – central value of the sigmoid

  • a – value of the sigmoid for variable -> -inf

  • b – value of the sigmoid for variable -> +inf

  • slope – slope of the sigmoid

Returns

the value of the sigmoid for the given value of the variable

mocafe.math.shf(variable, slope: float = 100)

Smoothed Heavyside Function (SHF) using the sigmoid function, which reads:

\[\frac{e^{slope * variable}}{(1 + e^{slope * variable})}\]
Parameters

  • variable – varible for the SHF

  • slope – slope of the SHF. Default is 100

Returns

the value of the sigmoid for the given value of the variable

mocafe.math.estimate_cancer_area(phi: fenics.Function)

Estimate cancer area for the phase field \(\varphi\) representing the cancer, where the phase field must have values between 0 and 1

Parameters

phi – phase field representing the cancer

Returns

the area of the given cancer

mocafe.math.estimate_capillaries_area(c: fenics.Function, threshold: float = 0.0)

Estimate capillaries area for the phase field c. It is assumed that c has values between 1 and -1, where 1 is a point with value 1 is inside the capillaries, while the points with value -1 are outside. Thus, this function assumes that all values of the field above 0 are part of the capillaries. It also possible to set a different threshold.

Parameters

  • c – phase field representing capillaries

  • threshold – threshold above a value of c is considered part of the capillaries. Default value is 0.

Returns

the area of the given field
